name: Leaside Manor Heritage Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: Stayed at the confederation suite it was a amazing room. glass shower and full 2 person jacuzzi, very clean and large. Access to the kitchen at all times is very nice for drinks and other things. Breakfast in bed came with the rental and was awesome. Perfect for celebrations. Rose pedals covered the heart shape jacizzi with a full rose on the side and candles, was perfect.
reviews.title: Very nice spot for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful heritage house, well set up, great breakfast and service from the staff. Everyone was very pleasant and willing to accomodate our needs. We enjoyed sharing breakfast at the long table with other guests, sharing the stories of our travels. I would recommend this spot to anyone.
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Here for the first time to close out a couple of super Rock weeks. The Jelly Bean was a very pleasant surprise; no stairs to climb, and right near the entrance, breakfast room, coffee, and ice. This little suite is very well thought out - the huge open (& I mean open!) bath with rain shower is right behind the head of the bed so you could get a little silly if you wished. Once you get used to hopping (figuratively) in and out of the tub, it's fine. The ironing board and iron are conveniently stashed in a little wall closet. The bedside tables can migrate to between the arm chairs for comfortable reading with a glass of whatever. Breakfasts are excellent, and the big table seats 10 or 12 (can't remember). Lots of chatter in the morning; have a conversation with Molly if you're lucky enough to have her serve your morning meal. She's got some great stories and is not shy about sharing her thoughts! (Don't get her going on the feds...) There is lots of parking below so do your baggage handling on Topsail through the main entrance, or, like me, you may be the sherpa-chauffeur. Location is good, except for the nasty construction on Topsail towards the harbour. Easy access to restaurants of all sorts. This is definitely good value, especially compared to other (not named) boutique types in town. We'll go back for sure...
reviews.title: Suite dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed at Leaside Manor (Irish Loop Suite) for the night of our honeymoon. We live in Conception Bay South, and were married in our home. Before departing on our honeymoon, we stayed a night in St John's. Everything was beautiful. We had rose petals and candles, chocolate covered strawberries and wine added onto the package.
reviews.title: Excellent stay for night of honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was beautiful, We overlooked the front garden and had an open concept bathroom with the large Jacuzzi tub. Everything was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Such a romantic getaway!
Leaside's Charm
reviews.text: On holidays from Sydney, Australia (in January 2008)- we were looking for a charming & authentic Newfie experience. Leaside was (is!) - perfect. Closes to downtown, with helpful, knowledgeable staff- the Leaside made for a perfect spot to base our tour of St John's from. The service was exceptional and we woke with anticipation each morning - looking forward to what would be served at breakfast. What a wonderful start to each day. The room (the Argentia) was beautiful and well appointed. We couldn't have found a lovelier spot to stay. I'm only sorry that we're so far away that we won't be back anytime soon- although I did extract a promise from my husband that - even if it took 10years- we'd be back to Leaside for another stay!

reviews.title: Excellent romantic getaway
reviews.text: Excellent stay at this wonderful place. Quiet, but witha very romantic atmosphere. Great service. There is sure to be a return to try another one of the rooms.

reviews.title: Leaside is a great romantic retreat
reviews.text: Leaside was great. I've been there twice and its a great getaway from the city or everday life. The staff are friendly and the rooms are beautiful! I will be visiting again!

reviews.title: Great spot to get away
reviews.text: We have stayed at Leaside on several occasions, always great service and atmosphere, and their suites are unbeatabe.

reviews.title: Fantastic evening
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the ever so romantic Parker room on our wedding night. When looking for a night out on that occasion the pictures and description of the Leaside Manor far exceeded the other bed and breakfasts that I looked at. We look forward to staying there again on our upcoming aniversary.

reviews.title: A break from the motel experience in a great town
reviews.text: We booked here based on other TripAdvisor reviews. Overall very positive experience. We flew into town very early (8 am), and stopped by Leaside to drop off a few bags before going out for the day. There was extensive renovation to the exterior going on, but in consideration to the guests, none of the work on the roof started until 9, and was always done by 5. We never heard a thing, and I know this probably increased the time and cost of the job. A few little glitches. When we came back at the end of the day, no one had taken our bags upstairs to our room, which would have been nice considering they were heavy and the stairs narrow. The building itself is an old residential structure that has had extensive renovations within. Nice quiet location, convienent to downtown. They had lots of information about local attractions. I experienced some problems with their wi-fi network, which seemed to work sporadically. It did improve over the course of our stay, and they have a computer available in the lobby.

reviews.title: The perfect place...
reviews.text: The suite we stayed in (the Bakeapple Suite) was wonderful. About twice the size of a normal motel room, with a very nice bathroom, an oversize bath in the room, good size screen for the television, and an integrated video player.

reviews.title: Fantastic and historic B&B
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the price of the room, and they did a great job serving us in the dining room at a large table. We got to know other guests, and by the time we left, we had made new friends. The food was excellent, and their willingness to accomodate my quirky tastes appreciated.

reviews.title: It was everything we imagined it would be...and more!
reviews.text: Just something to keep in mind - no elevator, moving bags can be a hassle. But all in all, I'm very glad we stayed here, easily the best accomodations of a two week trip to Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland.

reviews.title: quaint, quiet and comfortable
reviews.text: to celebrate some away time for your anniversary! The room was beautiful, the staff was fabulous and the breakfast delivered to our room was superb! We couldn't have asked for anything more! Well done - we'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed in the Jelly Bean Row Suite to celebrate our 2nd anniversary this past Saturday night! We stayed in Confederation Suite a couple of years back and both experiences were without a doubt the best. We love the atmosphere there, it is just so relaxing and cozy and of course VERY clean! The staff is very friendly there and the in room breakfast is awesome, you definitely won't go away hungry! I highly recommend Leaside and we definitely will be returning!
reviews.title: Amazing yet again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there for two nights in August. Enjoyed it thoroughly. The room was spacious and brightly coloured; and very clean. There was also a sitting / patio area outside our door (had our own private entrance from the outside). There is a comfortable common area to sit and read, or use the internet. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. We checked in late on Monday night, and a staff member prepared a cup tea and tea biscuits for us. Breakfast was superb. Conveniently located near the downtown area and within walking distance of many attractions.
reviews.title: Great Place to Relax..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was I thought it was a bit pricey..but, then I knew the price when I booked, so can't really complain. In spite of that, I would go there again...
reviews.title: Good B&B, quiet and restful stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to stay only at local suites and B&B, not chain hotels, during our stay in Newfoundland, and chose the Leaside Manor for our first couple of nights in St. John's after reading all the positive reviews.
reviews.title: Fantastic Wedding Night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Confederation Suite/Room...the decor appeared to match my husband's tastes and I gave him the choice of this one or the Port Royal (on the main floor). The Confederation is the smallest "suite" out of the 3 on the top floor of the main house (there is another room without a bathroom on the same floor), it was still a nice size, though. We arrived very late as our flight arrived in St. John's at 12:30 AM so we arranged to have everything at the door for us . Our information package for instructions on getting in the building and settling in were all ready for us when we got to the front entrance. There was lots of construction around the property so getting around and into the parking lot was a little frustrating, but that is no fault of the Manor.
reviews.title: Lovely Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Through no fault of the management, the road outside was subject to closure and noisy water-main installation (though a back entrance allowed access from another road. We had a very warm welcome and helpful advice on getting downtown by bus (30 min. walk). However, the room layout did not suit at all. There is a large jacuzzi bathtub in the sleeping area, between the window and the bed. The shower cubicle is tiny, but at least it is in a separate room with sink and toilet. The sitting area was nice. One of us cannot eat eggs, and on one morning there was not much else offered.
reviews.title: Poor room layout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: definitely the best B&B we stayed in during our cross province trip. The only issue was the road construction which caused some issues as we had to go through some barriers but not the fault of the Inn.
reviews.title: top of the line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was great, service was great, breakfast was great. Only complaint was that it was too warm in our room during the night, but when I woke I found the knob to turn the heat down.. Stupid on my part of course! Other then that our night was fabulous. The chocolate covered strawberries were my absolute favorite part of course!
reviews.title: Will go again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Service, food, rooms, location, and great Nfld hospitality were Five stars all the way. We stayed 3 nights and glad we did. Plan on staying more than one night.
reviews.title: We loved it and want to return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Just 25 mins from downtown to wonderful restaurants. The staff were helpful with directions - general St. John's info. Breakfasts were generous and the people visiting are interesting. Lv to Molly.
reviews.title: Beautiful place !!!!!��
Very Chic
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at Leaside for our two year anniversary. It was absolutely fabulous. What a surprise, I really enjoyed my stay. The room was amazing and the people there are so nice. We had a suite downstairs and it was really stylish and chic, I will never stay at a regular hotel again.

reviews.title: Unique Business Experience
reviews.text: The Leaside has become my home away from home when I travel to St. John's on business. For several years I have been able to combine business and personal travel at the Leaside.

reviews.title: Love the Leaside:)
reviews.text: The hospitality and ability to accomodate my business needs for breakfast, luncheon meetings, and presentations is top notch.

reviews.title: Absolutely in love with Leaside Manor!!
reviews.text: My clients truly appreciate the opporutnity to experience the Leaside, rather than the typical hotel format.
I have never been disappointed with my experiences at the Leaside. Elaine and her staff make this a place you look forward to returning to on the next visit to St. John's.

reviews.title: Warmth, hospitality, graciousness
reviews.text: The title of this review says it all!! From the greeting as we came in, to the wonderful breakfast, to the help with planning our trip through the rest of Newfoundland, everything was friendly, professional and charming.

reviews.title: Wonderful place to celebrate our 25th
reviews.text: Thanks so much to Elaine and her wonderful staff,

reviews.title: I can't wait to go back to Leaside!!
reviews.text: Sharon

reviews.title: Home away from Home
reviews.text: Comox, B.C.

reviews.title: Superb, intimate accommodation - knowledgeable staff
reviews.text: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and spent last three days of our Newfoundland trip here at the Leaside Manor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed and had our wedding at Leaside Manor, and it went off without a hitch. This was quite a feat given that one of us is located in Vancouver and the other in Washington, DC. Our sincere and heartfelt thanks to the staff, and especially Cindy! Most of our correspondence with Cindy was through email. We only met Cindy, in person, a week before our wedding, and both of us had the utmost faith upon meeting her that things would be perfect. Colin was also instrumental in having things run smoothly on our special day.
reviews.title: Our wedding/stay was perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our wedding guests stayed at Leaside Manor, or the neighbouring Compton House. The rooms are all very individualized and exceptionally clean. The Parker Suite is absolutely beautiful (traditional), while some other rooms are very modern. The rooms are so much more unique than a traditional (boring) hotel room. In the summer, I’d suggest a room with air conditioning. Some of the rooms also had heated floors, but it was too warm to use, but must be ideal during the winter. Also, some rooms have separate entrances (3 rooms in Leaside, and at least 1 room in Compton), which was very convenient for unloading the car. We loved being able to have our breakfast delivered to our room (which we did), or in the dining room (which we also did). The breakfasts are NOT to be missed! The staff will accommodate special food requests (e.g., instead of the Western omelette, one of us had scrambled eggs). Book rooms early to ensure availability/disappointment. The Manor is also a short drive/walk from Water Street (the heart of downtown St. John's).
reviews.title: Wonderful long weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our wedding was very small – 11 guests, so we had our dinner in the dining room (which seats 14). Evan, the Manor’s chef, achieved perfection with every dish. We had the wedding in the yellow Kilcombe room which was lovely and bright. That room has two beautiful fireplaces which provided a nice backdrop for signing the register. We took lots of pictures in the Manor, as well as outside in the beautiful garden and bright adirondack chairs. We also thought the prices for our wedding (food, wine and spirits, room rental, etc.) were very fair.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a same-sex couple, and we would recommend both Leaside Manor and Newfoundland for a wedding. We never experienced the slightest awkwardness being a same-sex couple – only genuine sentiments of the importance of equality.
reviews.title: Great St. John's B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: We couldn't imagine not staying at Leaside Manor on our next visit to St. John's!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience!

aka: Leaside Manor Heritage Hotel St. John`s
description: Leaside Manor is St. John's most popular small inn/B&B, offering romantic, double tub suites with fireplaces; fully-furnished executive apartments; unique meeting facilities with catered meals - all within a 5 minute drive of the downtown. An owner-hosted facility, Leaside offers a full cooked breakfast served in your suite; free wireless, parking; trip planning assistance. Leaside provides all the amenities of a hotel while giving you the personalized attention that only a small inn can offer.
